button.label: mm/dd/yyyy HH:mm
button.supertip: This will apply the formatting that it indicates. This seems to be the most useful/generic date format to use.

menu.label: bulk formatting
menu.supertip: Contains options for doing bulk formatting to a selection.

button.label: to numeric
button.supertip: Converts string to a numeric value. This is destructive.

button.label: to value
button.supertip: Converts numbers and formulas to values for the entire sheet. This is destructive.

button.label: trim
button.supertip: Performs a trim operation on all cells that are selected. This is destructive.

button.description: Make hyperlink from each cell in selection.
button.label: to hyperlink
button.supertip: This will create a hyperlink out of the given text in the cell.

menu.label: colorize
menu.supertip: This contains functions which are used to apply coloring to cells based on conditions. These are mainly like manual conditional formatting for advanced needs.

button.label: category
button.supertip: This will allow you to color cells based on the color of cells that contain the same values.

button.label: alt
button.supertip: This will run through the selection and alternate coloring.

button.label: split/keep
button.supertip: This will do a "split/keep" in place on the current selection. It will split by the delimeter and keep the values from the given index. Note that this is 0-based indexing. This ignores cells that cannot be split.

button.label: offset
button.supertip: This uses the text boxes above it. It will offset the current range by the given amounts (postive or negative).

button.label: cut transpose
button.supertip: This will execute a "cut transpose" operation. This allows for tranposing while moving formulas and references.

button.description: Copies the range and then clears any leftovers.
button.label: copy clear
button.supertip: Copies the range and then clears any leftovers.

button.label: split into rows
button.supertip: This will split out the given text into rows based on the delimeter given. This makes most sesne when splitting text that is in lines into actual rows.

button.label: join
button.supertip: This will join together all of the selected cells.

button.label: split cols
button.supertip: This will split the selected text into columns based on a given delimeter. It will extend out to an arbitrary number of splits without prompting about erasing other data. Beware.

button.label: unhide all
button.supertip: This will unhide all sheets in the workbook.

button.label: lock all
button.supertip: This will lock all sheets with a prompted password.

button.label: unlock
button.supertip: This will attempt to unlock all sheets with a prompted password. It will fail silently for those that it cannot open.

button.label: fix scroll bars
button.supertip: This will fix the scroll bars if the sheet is not showing them correctly. This can also be done by saving, but if you do not want to save then this is easier.

button.label: output sheet names
button.supertip: This will output the list of all sheet names in the current workbook.

button.label: waterfall fill
button.supertip: This will execute a waterfall fill. See the documentation for what this means and how it can be used.

button.label: series split
button.supertip: This will split out a column of data based on its categorical relationship to another column. See documentation for full details.

button.label: extend array
button.supertip: This will extend an array formula down to the end of the formula that is next to it.

button.label: delete hidden rows
button.supertip: This will delete all hidden rows on the current sheet. Good for inverting a filter for good.

button.label: recalc
button.supertip: This will force the "hardest" of recalculations. This is useful for PI to reset all of the formulas and recalc.

button.label: format all
button.supertip: This will apply a default formatting to all charts on the sheet.

button.label: XY matrix
button.supertip: This will create a scatter matrix of XY plots for all columns selected. Note that it prompts for the selection (with headers) after pressing the button.

button.label: flip XY
button.supertip: This flips the XY data for the selected charts. This uses ranges and is non-destructive.

button.label: merge
button.supertip: This takes all of the eries from the selected charts and merges them into the first chart. This uses ranges and is non-destructive.

button.label: split
button.supertip: This will take the selected charts and put each series in its own chart.

menu.label: find data
menu.supertip: This includes the commands to locate the series data in the chart.

button.description: Find the data used in the chart.
button.label: find X
button.supertip: This will select the range that is the x-axis values.

button.description: Find the data used in the chart.
button.label: find Y
button.supertip: This will select the range that is the y-axis values.

button.label: fit x/y to data
button.supertip: This will force the chart to set the range on the x/y-axis to the max and min from the data set.

button.label: fit x
button.supertip: This will force the chart to set the range on the x-axis to the max and min from the data set.

button.label: fit y
button.supertip: This will force the chart to set the range on the y-axis to the max and min from the data set.

button.label: auto x
button.supertip: This will revert to the default settings for the x axis range.

button.label: auto y
button.supertip: This will revert to the default settings for the y axis range.

button.label: extend series
button.supertip: This will extend the series of the selected charts to include all data in the block of data going down the sheet.

button.label: add trendlines
button.supertip: This will add trendlines for all selected charts (each series). It will also force a color onto the series in order to get around an odd Excel bug.

button.label: apply colors
button.supertip: This will color the series using the bUTL colors.

button.label: add titles
button.supertip: This will add titles to each y axis and x axis in use.

button.label: add title by series
button.supertip: This will set the y axis title equal to the series name.

button.label: PI data grid
button.supertip: This will create a grid of PI data that can be easily altered to get the actual values.

button.label: sample data
button.supertip: This will add in a grid of data for the list of PI tags starting in C1.

button.label: time series of PI
button.supertip: This will create a grid of charts for each PI tag that has sample data in the block.

button.label: add-ins
button.supertip: This will open the Excel dialog to see which add-ins are installed.

button.label: open folder
button.supertip: This will open the current folder that the file is saved within. If it has not been saved, it will tell you.

button.label: new features
button.supertip: This will open up a form that allows access to features that have not been given buttons in the Ribbon yet.

button.label: about
button.supertip: This will open a form containing information about this add-in.

button.label: help
button.supertip: This will open the documentation (PDF) for the add-in.
